newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares slip, seen to fall further.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares slip, seen to fall further.

text.p: Leading Russian shares slipped on Wednesday on profit-taking after fluctuations during the day, traders said, forecasting further losses on minor volatility.
The RTS index of 21 shares fell 2.83 percent to 166.73 on $14.7 million volume.

Mosenergo eased to $0.9375 from $0.9550 at Tuesday's close on the Russian Trading System (RTS). UES fell to $0.0749 from $0.0765. Gazprom rose to $0.345 from $0.315. LUKoil dropped to $8.79 from $8.95.
Alexander Fonarkov, a trader from Trinfiko brokerge, said foreign investors were holding off trading ahead of President Boris Yeltsin's announced end-of-month heart surgery.
"The market will be watching Yeltsin's cardiogram and it will be one of the main factors (in market movement)," he said.
Yeltsin said last week he would undergo a heart operation at the end of September and doctors said it would be a bypass.
Fonarkov said some foreign and Russian operators sold shares while the possibility remained, anticipating further market stagnation and decreased liquidity.
Boris Shvedsky, a broker from IK Aton, said the market was waiting impatiently for new Western orders, but even at current low prices there was very little buying.
"Prices have fallen low enough and many are interested to buy," he said. "But buying is going on very cautiosly. Many are waiting for the end of September and do not want to push the market up."
